Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Remove superflous AddImagePart method overload." (#1425) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Merged pull request "Tif and Jp2 ImagePartTypes" (#1417) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi!

I commited this approved PR: https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/pull/1304
The intention was to support ".tif" extension.

I have since recognized the PR did not create support for ".tif" ImagePartType extension properly. The fix supported ".tif" by mapping it to ".tiff" extension.

This is not the right way of doing it. ".tif" should be independently supported, because some organizations may want to only support one of these extensions to reduce complexity (despite the TIFF standard fully supports both extensions).

This new PR fully creates ".tif" as an independent ImagePartType alongside ".tiff".

This PR also adds JPEG-2000 ImagePartType extension ".jp2". Many archives accept JPEG-2000 and TIFF images for long-term preservation.

I try to PR into main, because it is a small fix, that does not break anything or change anything significantly, and I don't really know which other branch to PR into.

PS. I had to close another malformed PR and fork the repo anew, to do this properly, to cancel out the 1304 unintended recommit, which I had put into my own main instead of a branch, when I did that awhile ago.

In a recent change @tomjebo made, we consolidated many of the methods for adding parts. Looks like https://github.com/dotnet/Open-XML-SDK/blob/main/src/DocumentFormat.OpenXml/Packaging/ImagePartTypeInfo.cs was left - it and its calling method should be removed
